metadata.title: CVE-2019-20395 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS for NVIDIA BlueField (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A stack consumption issue is present in libyang before v1.0-r1 due to theself-referential union type containing leafrefs. Applications that uselibyang to parse untrusted input yang files may crash.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-20395` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libyang-cpp1 - 1.0.176-1
libyang-tools - 1.0.176-1
libyang1 - 1.0.176-1
yang-tools - 1.0.176-1
No subscription required

libyang-tools - 2.0.112-6ubuntu2
libyang2 - 2.0.112-6ubuntu2
libyang2-tools - 2.0.112-6ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libyang package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.0.176-1').
libyang2 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.0.112-6ubuntu2').
